website_summaries.verdict: One of the highest-rated pet barriers on the market, this top-quality product provides exceptional safety for everyone in the vehicle.
pros: Horizontal and vertical adjustments guarantee item will work in any sized vehicle
Product stays in place by using out-of sight-cords that wrap around headrests
Easy to install, with no tools required
cons: Some animals figure out how to open the adjustable tubes

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely the best! I have a 2015 Toyota Rav4, it is perfect! I did add bungee cords to the bottom as some suggested. I can move my seats, tilt them just like they said. I said I knew it was the right barrier when I seen the cattle dog lol. Now everyone is safer, thank you so much!
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Can't rate highly enough
customer_reviews.text: I had a hard time finding a sturdy barrier that would fit my Honda Civic, was easy to assemble and install, and would keep my dogs safe and comfortable during a cross-country drive. Without the Zookeeper, I would have been much more nervous during our adventure. It only took me about 10 minutes from opening the package to completing installation in my car. I did add a couple of extra bungees to further secure the bottom to the car. My tethered, secured dogs could see me, which made them feel better, and they couldn't distract me, which made me feel better! I even found a way to attach a water dish so they could drink between stops. Highly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: PJ

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for my application
customer_reviews.text: I have 2 dogs one 100lb & one 130lb that go with me everywhere. This worked perfectly in my wife's Subaru Forster. I added a bungees at the bottom to seat belt brackets & at the top to the grab rails for the front seat... made it solid the dogs looked at it pushed it a little saw it was secure and just laid down in back. PERFECT!! I ordered another for my Chevy Equinox, not installed yet. I am going to add the pipe insulation to them as suggested by another purchaser. If I can figure out how to add to this review later I will add review on use in my Equinox and add pictures.
customer_reviews.author: Buckaroo

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't fit all vehicles
customer_reviews.text: This is the best pet barrier we've bought. However, it does not fit our 2014 Subaru Forester well at all. It is mildly sturdy, but not for a rambunctious Rottweiler. Our dog can dislodge it by just bumping into it. The extendable arms need to be taped together otherwise they will move out of position. Make sure it will fit your vehicle properly (the fault not of the barrier, but vehicle design in my case).
customer_reviews.author: CatnWolf

customer_reviews.title: Good purchase
customer_reviews.text: This has been a godsend. We reclaimed control of our center console. This was the only one that we could find that would let the seats adjust differently. The only reason it doesn't get 5 stars is because, for the price, you should not have to add bungies for the bottom. Which you do. Gotta say, I do love giving my friends rides in the back seat when its installed.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Contain's my hooligans!
customer_reviews.text: I've had several different kinds of dog barriers for my Camry, even some barred ones that look similar. None held up to my wild 90 lb. boys until now. I love this Zookeeper Pet Barrier. It's sturdy and stands up to their pulling, chewing and paws. A necessity for safe driving! Plus it was quick and easy to install, even for a "mature" woman like me LOL! Highly recommend this as your first choice. I wasted money on lesser products before I found this.
customer_reviews.author: Jean Holmaan

customer_reviews.title: True Safety for my pups and I...Thank you
customer_reviews.text: This was the best purchase! I have two crazy pups that I would constantly battle to keep them from standing in between the front seats on the arm rest. Now I don't have to worry about our safety! Very thankful! Btw...if you utilize a hammock you don't have to be concerned about tying down the bottom of the Zookeeper. It was designed to move with your seats, so tying the bottom down with 2 additional bungie cords doesn't make sense. But you can do you...just sayin.
customer_reviews.author: Mel Hansen

customer_reviews.title: Keeps dogs safe in the back away from the driver.
customer_reviews.text: Installed this in our Ford F-150 to keep our pups in the back. We did (like other reviewers) add additional bungees to anchor the middle bottom down after one dog jumped into the back floor (instead of the seat) and put his head up under it then jumped into the front seat. After anchoring the middle down, this hasn’t happened again. The dogs are safe and secure in the back- no more leapfrogging into the front seat which isn’t safe for anyone (especially with two 75+ pound pups)! This thing is great!!!
customer_reviews.author: MMS

customer_reviews.title: Cords are worthless
customer_reviews.text: Used the product for 6 days before my puppy was able to pull the cord out of the hook, which resulted in a puppy disaster. The cord and hook or bungee cord is so worthless and cheap. It's disappointing that for the price, a better bungee cord couldn't be provided.
customer_reviews.author: earleville1

customer_reviews.title: Completely effective with crazy dogs!
customer_reviews.text: This thing seems expensive for what it is, and is 100% effective if you need to keep your canines completely clear of the front seat. Super configurable for any type (standard) vehicle, yes, it will fit. Easy to remove with a couple supplied bungee cords with adjustable hooks, simple to swap it to another vehicle. The adjustable slide tubes (for width adjustment) can slide out on their own and hit the windows, should tape that or something. Crazy dogs are zero issue with this thing. You'll only need one, forever!
customer_reviews.author: Dragon9

customer_reviews.title: Works, but mounting to seats doesn't function as well.
customer_reviews.text: I have this in a honda fit. Size fits perfectly behind my front seats. The problem is that you really need to keep both seats in the same position. If one seat is more forward than the other, or one is reclining more than the other, this unit doesn't work as well. After buying this I think I would rather have one that has tension rods. I plan on putting tension rods and then attacking the barrier to that. Require additional stretch cord to attach.
customer_reviews.author: Lynn

customer_reviews.title: Used another reviewer’s tip
customer_reviews.text: My dog thinks she can drive better than me and constantly tried to jump up front to argue the point. Not anymore. She is safe in back now, rests her face between bars for pets and treats. WE are much happier now! Another review mentioned 12 pack of bungees from Home Depot. HIGHLY RECOMMEND DOING THIS! (Fit is perfect now)Toyota Tundra 2018 double cab.
customer_reviews.author: MAGA

customer_reviews.title: Elegant, universal
customer_reviews.text: I was in need of a way to keep a big dog (who climbs over the dog hammock we already got!) out of the front seat. I was hesitant since there really isn’t anything in my car such as headrest mechanisms to affix stuff to. This attaches neatly with two bunjees, I can see why people add more but my dog isn’t small enough to try to fit through gaps so the two is perfectly fine for us.
customer_reviews.author: AWood

customer_reviews.title: Ok if you dog is calm and doesn’t mind riding in the back
customer_reviews.text: Buick Enclave with 80lb golden retriever: it fit across the back well however my dog can push the sides to squeeze through, he was also able to climb over the top because it does not go to the ceiling. In addition the bungee cord has broken after 1 week, I was able to tie it together but not very sturdy.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Easy to install and just what I needed for my Subaru Outback. I do wish there were some extra bungees to secure it to the bottom of the seats but did not necessarily need them, just felt it would be more secure if it was. My dog is 65 lbs and this is perfect for keeping him in the back seat, he is not one to challenge it when left alone and I think a determined or anxious dog might want their way around, but it is great for just keeping in from hopping into the front seat while we're running errands.
customer_reviews.author: OnlyAlissa

customer_reviews.title: My lab puppy quickly figured out that he can easily move the adjustable tubes with his snout
customer_reviews.text: My lab puppy quickly figured out that he can easily move the adjustable tubes with his snout, to give himself enough of a gap to get into the back seat of my RAV4. When moving the adjustable tubes in and jumping, he figured out that he can just grab the top bar and the bungees stretch enough that he can use the frame to catapult himself into the next seat. Loads of fun for the dog. Not so much for me.
customer_reviews.author: C. Garrity

customer_reviews.title: The only barricade I will use in my expensive,  luxury car
customer_reviews.text: This is a great option to the flimsy mesh barricades and the gaudy ones that require a day to assemble and tear up your nice seats. I only use it occasionally so I love the ease and convenience of putting it in and taking it back out. I've tried several different ones, only to be disappointed and return immediately. This one is a keeper. And I use it in my high end jeep grand cherokee so the fact that it doesn't tear up my seats is a absolute must!
customer_reviews.author: Leslie

customer_reviews.title: Really Works Well to keep dogs in back seat
customer_reviews.text: We have a rescue dog who rides with us everywhere. When we leave the car on an errand, we would come back to find him in the front. This keeps him in the back seat, and he has adjusted very well. He curls up and looks relaxed, and we are not dealing with dog hair in the front. And by the way, he is good sized Lab, so it definitely contains a larger dog.
customer_reviews.author: Susan K. D.

customer_reviews.title: Great Product
customer_reviews.text: This barrier does everything I needed well, not much more to say. We installed in a 2019 Subaru Outback, attached to the front seat head rest very easily. When needed, the rear seat can be used with the barrier attached. It's not obtrusive to rear seat passengers.
customer_reviews.author: Robert E

customer_reviews.title: Pet barrier works for vehicles with third row of seats
customer_reviews.text: While this barrier was intended to keep pets out of the front seat, I am using it to keep my dog in the cargo area. I like the low bars because my Tahoe has an opening for people to get into the third row of bucket seats. I had to sort of make up my installation plan and add a few bungee cords, but it is doing the trick of keeping my large dog in the cargo area on the flat deck.
customer_reviews.author: Denise E. Greller

customer_reviews.title: Get it Set Up Right the First Time
customer_reviews.text: I like this product, but I made the mistake of leaving just enough room on the sides for my Shepherd mix to wiggle through. Once she discovered she could wiggle through, she kept doing it. I had to remove it before she tore something up. If you get one of these, make sure you start out by adjusting the sides out as much as possible.
customer_reviews.author: Coffeeguy

customer_reviews.title: Bar is great! Have spare bungee cords on hand.
customer_reviews.text: Bar kept an 80 pound puppy in the backseat. Well made. The bungee cords broke within the first day so he prepared to have some on hand for replacement. Why pack your products with those cheap cords? Mine broke mid-trip so had to hurriedly make pit stop so the pup wouldn’t climb into my lap.
customer_reviews.author: Tammy

customer_reviews.title: A total lifesaver!!
customer_reviews.text: This barrier is a lifesaver! We have 2 Golden Retrievers that love to climb into the front seat while we are driving. They think they are lap dogs and only want to sit on our laps! As bad as I feel having to block them in the back seat, this barrier just gives us the secure feeling that we won’t have to drive with one hand and wrestle our girls with the other :) They don’t seem to mind as the openings are large enough for them to stick their noses through for a little love :)
customer_reviews.author: Cheryl F

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: We use this on our 2005 Dodge Ram 1500 to contain our 75 lb German Shepherd. Works fantastic! However as other reviewers have said, with the bungee cords they give you, your dog may be able to get underneath and climb up into the front seat, but quick fix, just add more bungee cords. Definitely money well spent.
customer_reviews.author: Paul Prochaska

customer_reviews.title: Very good product!!
customer_reviews.text: I use this in my F250 as a barrier. It works fantastic for keeping our Dog in the back Seat. Yet we can still reach back and Pat him on the nose. It will allow us to recline the seats if desired. Worth the price asked.
customer_reviews.author: David Rice

customer_reviews.title: Looks nice, very sturdy, customizable with a little thought
customer_reviews.text: Perfect. A little bit of time to figure out the best way to install it for our vehicle (4Runner). Added a few straps from product to D-clips on the floor. Looks nice, not hokey like some. Expect it to last well. Will be able to move from front to back as needed without problems. Recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: A.K.

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy, Well-Built Gate - Effective and Stays Put
customer_reviews.text: I bought a hammock hoping it would keep my three large Labrador retrievers in the back of my Rav4. No such luck. I researched gates and this one had the best reviews. I took note of other reviewer suggestions to buy additional bungee cords, which was not necessary. See picture for how I attached the bungee cords. The gate is incredibly stable. I put the hammock that I bought from Orvis over the gate and it looks professional - like I bought everything straight from the dealer.
customer_reviews.author: GT

customer_reviews.title: Pricey Pet Barrier, but Effective
customer_reviews.text: I’m so glad I spent the extra money for the Zookeeper. It really keeps the dog in the back passenger seat of my sedan. Like other reviewers, the two included bungee cords are not enough to anchor the Zookeeper securely. At least two more are needed to secure the bottom to the seats. This is why I gave the product four stars.
customer_reviews.author: Fran

customer_reviews.title: Pain to Install Properly But It Works
customer_reviews.text: I tried several barriers to keep our three large dogs from getting in the front of our SUV and this one works the best. It was a pain to install it properly, but once it was installed it worked. Hubby has to adjust it now and then but the pups stay in the back and everyone is safer.
customer_reviews.author: Maryanne V. Fraleigh

customer_reviews.title: versatile barrier
customer_reviews.text: This barrier works well for me. When I drop my dogs off at day care I have to let the out the side door of my SUV due to street traffic. I attached the barrier to the middle and other side head rest this allowed me to fold down the seat on the curbside and the dogs can slide under the barrier to get out. When the seat is up the barrier keeps them from jumping over the seat. My only complaint is that the two bungee cords are not really enough to hold the barrier securely in place. I am going to add some other straps to keep it from flopping around.
customer_reviews.author: Juli D

customer_reviews.title: This one really works!
customer_reviews.text: After trying four other less-expensive dog barriers accompanied by whining dogs and patience lost because they didn't work I picked this and promptly ordered. Oh my gosh, lifesaver! Fits the back seat of my husband's 2015 chevy silverado 1500 extended cab perfectly. He sits more reclined than I and it still works perfectly. It even covers the middle arm rest perfectly. Save yourselfthe hassle, but this one first!
customer_reviews.author: Nik2

customer_reviews.title: It met my needs
customer_reviews.text: It is easy to assemble. I have a 2017 Dodge Dakota and I use it between the middle row and the folded down cargo area. My dogs are well mannered so it is enough to deter them. I think a small dog could slip through the bars. It doesn't rattle, but is only secured around the head rests so I would need to figure out a more effective way to anchor the bottom if hauling more energetic animals.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Liked concept, but did not work for long with Husky mix
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would work. After reading other reviews, I planned for using extra bungles. First frame was damaged. One of the connector posts was pushed in, making it unusable. Company shipped a new one right away. Installation: It took a while to get the frame bungied just right. The supplied bungles did not provide enough support. Used two addt'l heavy duty bungles. It worked for a couple of trips in the car. However, my dog was too strong (Shep/Husky mix) and too clever. I had to return. Seemed like a neat idea, being adjustable. It just didnt work for my dog.
customer_reviews.author: Laurie

customer_reviews.title: Great but a little awkward
customer_reviews.text: The product absolutely does its job keeping animals out of the front seat. From Cavachon to bulldog this works. My only issue is it isn't the best looking thing. My wife is short and i sit tilted back so it looks a little goofy but it works. Dogs don't even try to get up which kinda amazed me
customer_reviews.author: Ashley Sherman

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed!
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely wonderful! The Zoo Keeper is stylish, strong, and durable. My 80lb chocolate Labrador can no longer stand on the center console or enter the passenger seat...I can now relax while driving! If the Zoo Keeper does not work for you, the issue is with behavior rather than product quality. Side note: assembly took about 2 minutes and installation required an additional 5 minutes. Fits perfectly in my 15' Honda CRV.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: I like this more than my dog does!
customer_reviews.text: Receiving this as a Christmas gift was actually exciting for me! After having researched various pet barriers I found this one and loved the versatility of moving quickly from one vehicle to another. An added plus was not having vertical posts digging into my car's headliner. The Zookeeper is heavy enough to prevent a dog that is comfortable in the back seat or cargo area of a vehicle from getting in the driver's face. Not sure that a more persistent dog would remain contained in the back but it sure would help. I love this for dog shows and my dogs appreciate not being stuck in crates during travel.
customer_reviews.author: N. McCreary

customer_reviews.title: Good if your dog is not a escape artist
customer_reviews.text: I really wanted to like this more. I guess its not the products fault but more of my dogs. My dog can escape from just about anything and it did not take him too long to figure this out. I followed the instructions from other reviewers and bungied these at the bottom to keep it in place. It is easy to put together. You know your own dog and if they normally get out and escape things expect the same result with this.
customer_reviews.author: Josh Simpson

customer_reviews.title: Good device for keeping the animals in a designated area.
customer_reviews.text: This works great in my Traverse. I put it up behind my second row of captains chairs. And it does the job keeping my dogs from going any further forward. The adjustable width allows it to follow the interior contour and keep my fur kids in the designated area. I would recommend it to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: Almost 5 stars! Best purchase!
customer_reviews.text: The ONLY criticism I have is that the side adjustable sliding arms don't fit snuggly enough to stay put. It's relatively easy to slide them back and forth; which, may, make it possible for an escape artist to sneak through. Fits Subaru Outback perfectly, attaching to the headrests with included bungee cords; and attaching the bottom to a tether hook with purchased Wrap-It strap.
customer_reviews.author: Holly

customer_reviews.title: Great design, with lots of adjustments.
customer_reviews.text: I have a Toyota Highlander with second row bucket seats. I installed the barrier behind these seats, and it fits perfectly without having to anchor into the car roof like some barriers. Very adjustable. A little pricey, but well worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Dononlake

customer_reviews.title: Prevents dingo attacks!
customer_reviews.text: At first we were skeptical, we thought there was no way this could contain our wild beast. We followed other suggestions and used additional bungees to secure in place, and have very successfully avoided a vicious dingo from attacking. This is the best road trip we have ever taken with this dog.
customer_reviews.author: ThatIsBananas

customer_reviews.title: Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I was able to move the rear seats forward in my previous vehicle, so I never needed a barrier. I don't have that option in my new one and really wasn't thrilled about having to get a barrier. However, I'm very happy with this. It is exceptionally easy to install and since it is flat, it easy to store when I don't need it. I have two 85-pound Rottweilers, and the barrier does what is needed.
customer_reviews.author: MJP

customer_reviews.title: It just works but expensive
customer_reviews.text: Amazing product, fits great in my 2020 Tacoma! I have 2 labs and this thing keeps them in the back seat no issues. Did not need extra bungees like some reviews have said. Only negative I’d say is the price is a little high, this thing can’t cost more than $10 to make.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had for 7 years & still love it!
customer_reviews.text: I bring my dogs to work to my grooming shop on a regular basis. Having them confined to the back is safer when driving so they don't climb on me. It isn't as good keeping the little dogs in back because they can squeeze thru but the big dogs do fine. I like this style better than the kind with tension rods because it's super easy to add & remove.
customer_reviews.author: Sara B.

customer_reviews.title: This product was easy to install and
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2015 Subaru Outback purchased specifically to accommodate my GSD. She likes to jump in the front seat, so I needed a way to corral here in the large rear cargo area. This product was easy to install and, as I have only had it for a short time, is keeping my 90 lb. dog in the back where she should be. It is important to note, she has NOT attempted to challenge the barrier yet. I like the fact that I can see her and she can see me, and I can reach through to pet her if I wish. If/when she challenges the barrier, will update this post.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works Great - Easy to Install
customer_reviews.text: I am so glad I purchased this product. It is simple to install and works great. I have a very energetic black lab that was all over the place when we had her in the truck. This barrier give her a safe space to lay down. It comes in and out of the truck easily. It can go into any of our vehicles as needed. It even folds down with our seats when we are loading the back.
customer_reviews.author: William P.

customer_reviews.title: Strong barrier
customer_reviews.text: This kept our 85lb German Shepherd coming through to front seat while making a 24 hour trip across country. I needed something simple but sturdy and this fit my needs. This was used in a 2017 Honda Accord Sport.
customer_reviews.author: Zach

customer_reviews.title: It works!
customer_reviews.text: I tried several restraints to keep my Vizsla (otherwise known as the velcro dog) from trying to sit on my lap while I was driving. She would slip or pull herself out of them with ease. Once I installed this, she tried to get through and immediately realized that she couldn't and she just settled down. It was very easy to assemble and install. I love that I can put my seat back when stopped and that my passenger can move their seat back more than mine.
customer_reviews.author: nancy de fusco

customer_reviews.title: Good Quality
customer_reviews.text: It's an easy install an has easy adjustments on the barrier and the bungie cords. It's a little harder to remove the bungie cords due to the way the latch is constructed. It does need an additional bungie to secure the bottom but you can get another bungee anywhere. It performed as advertised and fits securely against the back seat of my Hyundai Santa Fe. I have not used it on the bucket front seats.
customer_reviews.author: Tess

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy, easy to install, shipped quickly. I leave it up all the time, love e that it doesn't block my view of my dogs or my rearview mirror. A little rattley at times, but not too loud. Should come with additional strap(s) for bottom of it as other reviewers had mentioned. I purchased extra bungee cords with it and works great. I like that I can use it behind front row of seats or behind second row in my 2016 Ford Edge.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: Worth the Money
customer_reviews.text: I have a very active Dog and other barriers have not been able to keep her in the back behind the seats. I researched and read a lot of review before buying this and it works as well as everyone says it does. Love the flexibility of still being able to recline the seats so I don't have to take it out every time we travel without the dog.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Extremely well made and sturdy. Originally I order a net divider and then ...
customer_reviews.text: Extremely well made and sturdy. Originally I order a net divider and then realized my Labrador retriever puppy would just eat it! This pet barrier is infallible and also provides a safety barrier to keep her from flying in the front seat in case I need to slam on my breaks. I loved it so much I bought a second one for my husband's truck.
customer_reviews.author: Karen W

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I needed for a stress-free, undistracted drive w/the dogs
customer_reviews.text: This is exactly what I needed & the fit on my '17 Tundra Crewmax is perfect. The dogs can do dog stuff in the backseat w/o being a distraction, nuisance or hassle.
customer_reviews.author: JT

customer_reviews.title: Difficult installation
customer_reviews.text: This did not work well in my Grand Cherokee. The “bungees” that can with it were cheap quality. Ended up getting additional bungees and lashed them around several things in the Jeep to keep it sturdy and secure.
customer_reviews.author: MW

customer_reviews.title: Even the dogs seem happier!
customer_reviews.text: Pretty close to perfect. Assembly instructions were kinda out of order. "Insert c-shaped sections into main section... BUT FIRST place the rubber sleeves on the main section.". Anyway keeps the pups from trying to drive and I can even get gas without a jail break.
customer_reviews.author: Greg

customer_reviews.title: Great design and it is made in  the USA !!!  LETS SUPPORT USA PRODUCTS NOT CHINA!!!
customer_reviews.text: This is a simple design. The side rails expand so it can fit in a compact or SUV. The way it attaches to the seat, allows you to adjust the seat forward or back. This made in the USA, and I am all for supporting them.
customer_reviews.author: TonyMar

customer_reviews.title: Nice but overpriced
customer_reviews.text: Works well but not worth $80. I didn't want a cage that pressed against the roof and wear the headliner. This works well strapping to the back of the 2nd row seat headrests. And this is for a 16 Traverse. At least the quality is good for $80.
customer_reviews.author: DLC

customer_reviews.title: It works for our Great Dane and our Mastif Mix
customer_reviews.text: The only guard we have found that works in our crew cab truck to keep the dogs in the back, away from us in the front. Thus much safer driving. It works for our Great Dane and our Mastif Mix.
customer_reviews.author: Connie F.

customer_reviews.title: It works! Just add some zip ties
customer_reviews.text: Was skeptical at first. Seemed to simple. It does work if you secure it with a few zip ties. My dog is incredibly strong and he can't get past it. I also use a seatbelt attachment which helps. Look them up.
customer_reviews.author: EdwardB

customer_reviews.title: Great product! It was so easy to assemble and ...
customer_reviews.text: Great product! It was so easy to assemble and install and has worked great to keep the dogs in the back of the car. I highly recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Shop Girl

customer_reviews.title: Easy to adjust, works great
customer_reviews.text: We have 3 Great Danes and this barrier is awesome for keeping them contained in the back of the car. It was easy to install and adjust to fit in our Mazda 3 hatchback.
customer_reviews.author: CMish

customer_reviews.title: Love it
customer_reviews.text: I have an 09 Jeep Grand Cherokee. We have this on the back seat to keep my dog in the trunk area. It bungees to the headrests and stays put. My dog does not try to push on it, so I'm not sure how it will hold up for dogs who will not be content to be confined. For our purposes it's great-- doesn't rattle when we hit bumps, stays put, and is easy to install.
customer_reviews.author: Nicole

customer_reviews.title: Great buy!
customer_reviews.text: Super easy to install; took maybe 5 minutes. My (80-lb) dog hates being left behind/away from me... if there's a way out of something he'll find it. He's ripped leashes and torn through tents. This barrier keeps him contained. I'm confident leaving him in the back of the car with the front windows all the way down and this barrier in between.
customer_reviews.author: Devon Marks

customer_reviews.title: good gate.
customer_reviews.text: This is a very good product , easy to put up and take down and does the job without blocking the view.
customer_reviews.author: Charles S. Sylvia

customer_reviews.title: Simple
customer_reviews.text: Very easy to use.. pretty easy to take out.. and great to have the dog hair only in the back seat.
customer_reviews.author: Islanders

customer_reviews.title: easy to assemble and install but seems the sides may slide
customer_reviews.text: keeps my large dogs in the back. the only thing that worries me is sturdiness. the end pieces dont feel like they will keep from sliding if pushed from the ends. my big dogs haven’t tried to get around the sides but they may once they feel comfy around it.
customer_reviews.author: andrea remke

customer_reviews.title: What an awesome product! Easy to put together
customer_reviews.text: What an awesome product! Easy to put together, simple to install and because it's adjustable, it will fit perfectly in any vehicle. No rattles and no damage to the headliner!
customer_reviews.author: Roxanne Harley

customer_reviews.title: Not the Answer for Me
customer_reviews.text: I have mixed feelings about this dog barrier. I had a barrier that was permanently installed in my 2000 Subaru Forester. I wanted something that I could easily remove in my 2015 Forester. I'm glad it doesn't touch the top of the car but it just doesn't feel securely fixed. I did add more tie downs to fit more securely. I just don't trust it.
customer_reviews.author: FearlessPhyl

customer_reviews.title: FINALLY SOMEONE HAS COME UP WITH A BARRIER THAT WORKS!
customer_reviews.text: Looked forever for the right barrier to keep my 3 JRT's in the back of my Equinox...finally bought the tension type with a door. Tough to install, the little terrorists could crawl underneath and make their way to the front. So started the search again, this one came, installed myself in about 4 minutes and it is absolutely the perfect barrier. No rattles while driving, dogs don't even mind it since they can still be close to the front seats and me. It is just how described too, moves with the seats, lighweight and looks good too. Highly recommend buying this one, you will love it and so will the dog(s)!
customer_reviews.author: susan s

customer_reviews.title: Zoo Keeper is a Keeper
customer_reviews.text: So far so it's been a miracle cure keeping Sparky from jumping in between front and back seats. He's a 65 pound one year old hound puppy and very enegetic! This pet barrier has actually worked!!! I was reluctant to make a review until I knew for sure that it would. I had to re-adjust the barrier to a higher connection behind the seats to insure that Sparky wouldn't make the leap. It's very simple to assemble and install. I think that Zoo Keeper is a Keeper!!
customer_reviews.author: Rachel George

customer_reviews.title: Best car gate I’ve seen. It works!
customer_reviews.text: It works, doesn’t damage the car and the two dogs are happy staying in the back of the car. No hassle!!
customer_reviews.author: Book worm

customer_reviews.title: Works well, but you'll need to stabilize the bottom
customer_reviews.text: It keeps my leash chewing dog in the back seat. I had to add an extra bungee cord in the middle bottom to stablize it. Otherwise it is only attached to headrests and the dog would be able to squeeze underneath the middle by pulling it back. I put it around the center console and it works perfectly.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Keeping my doggies safe
customer_reviews.text: This is by far better than my initial purchase (a mesh thing) which wasn't good for my pit bulls, but the Zookeeper was the answer to keep my furbabies secure and from attempting to get to me in the front. I recommend the Zookeeper for dog and driver safety.
customer_reviews.author: annette

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for keeping the dogs in the back. Tried other barriers and my dogs jump over. This one hooks to your headrests and adjusts with your seating position. Great product. Keeps me same lol
customer_reviews.author: Annie May

customer_reviews.title: well worth the money
customer_reviews.text: This worked great! We used it in a mini van behind the middle seats to keep 2 labs in the back area. It's not long enough to go down to the floor, but we had a cooler that took care of this area. The sides extend to where you need it and it was so simple to put in place. I agree with others, that the bungees are a little on the skimpy side, but I used my own and pulled them very tight. It stayed put and didn't make any noise during our 12 hour trip! Great product!
customer_reviews.author: KY fan

customer_reviews.title: perfect!
customer_reviews.text: This fit perfect in a 2012 Honda Civic Sedan. We have a husky who loves to try to sit in the front seat so this was the perfect block for her. We did buy two extra bungee cords to fasten the middle part down on the bottom (only because the dog is too determined to get in the front!) but after that it worked like a charm. I must also mention we have tried doggy seat belts in which our husky has chewed through them to get to the front, so having something to block her was a must!
customer_reviews.author: Ruth

customer_reviews.title: Very effective in SUV with 75# hound
customer_reviews.text: This pet barrier is great for keeping my loving and slobbery hound dog (who also sheds periodically) in the back of my SUV. So easy to assemble and secure in place. My boy hasn't pushed on or moved it an inch; whereas before installation his wet nose was making trails on my windshield, slobber on the head rests, etc. Love it !!!!! Thanks to everyone who provided reviews; they were very helpful to me in deciding on this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Lori

customer_reviews.title: really works !
customer_reviews.text: This was easy to install, and my wife loves not having the dogs try to get in her lap while driving. HIGHLY RECOMMEND !
customer_reviews.author: Maxwell Abbzugg XI

customer_reviews.title: spaces too wide
customer_reviews.text: I returned this item as it didn't work in my Acura coupe (the console got in the way of placement). Also, my 50 pound dog would have gotten her paws and head caught in the bar spaces. The barrier was not well constructed: the center poles and the trombone parts did not fit well together. As for "moving with the seats" . . . well, yes, but incredibly awkward.
customer_reviews.author: expat

customer_reviews.title: Great!
customer_reviews.text: This is the 4th barrier I have tried in a few months. I'm pair it with a backseat hammock and it works perfect!! Could use a few extra bungees for stability, but over all I'm thrilled i found something that keeps my German shepherd / pit bull mix in the back seat!
customer_reviews.author: River Dog

customer_reviews.title: Dog barrier dilemma
customer_reviews.text: I have an awkward space in the back of my Prius that I wanted to block off for my dog. I was able to use this in a somewhat jimmy rigged fashion but it works great.
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Works great for my Ford Explorer with second row captain chairs.
customer_reviews.text: I have a 2017 Ford Explorer with second row captain chairs. This will extend down and seal off that area between chairs. There is nothing screwed in or otherwise through pressure to your car. It attaches using bungie cords. Does not rattle or obstruct the view. Works great to keep my calm 60 pound Black Lab in the cargo area.
customer_reviews.author: Joan Matthews

customer_reviews.title: This is an EXCELLENT pet barrier
customer_reviews.text: This is an EXCELLENT pet barrier. As the mother to a pit bull and a beagle and the owner of a 2017 Jeep Renegade with leather interior, this is the PERFECT solution. Combined with window covers and a cargo liner, I'm having a blast traveling with my pups and my car is 100% protected.
customer_reviews.author: Sloan R.

customer_reviews.title: Pure Genius Invention
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely love this product...... Had to buy more bungees to secure the bottom from being pulled out by my Mastweiler...... He has tried to pull it out and has been unsuccessful ..... It just flexes and tilts with the seats !!!! Being attached to the seats, it leaves my dog a lot more room then he would've had with the fixed barrier type..... Genius !!!!
customer_reviews.author: 1 Guys Take

customer_reviews.title: Pet Barrier
customer_reviews.text: This works great in our Town and Country Van. Had to add a couple of cords to keep it secured at the bottom, but works just fine. Our dog is still able to see us, but not able to get into our seats when we get out to shop.
customer_reviews.author: Cathy Couto

customer_reviews.title: Really easy to install.
customer_reviews.text: Simple to install, easy to remove. Does not squeak or rattle and keeps my 55# golden and 20# shelties in place. I'm not sure about the longevity of the rubber ties but they would be inexpensive to replace if necessary. My dogs aren't escape artists, I'm sure a truly determined pup could chew or work their way though but this product would work for most canine travelers.
customer_reviews.author: Dog MomTop Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: The barrier works like a charm
customer_reviews.text: I was so tired of battling the dog on every car trip. That is over now. The barrier works like a charm. We have a Chrylser 300 and were afraid the barrier would be an akward fit. NOT TRUE. Fits great. Cant say he liked it but after a couple days, he realized it was a fait accompli. We can now breathe a little easier knowing he is safe and so are we. Nicely done Zoo Keeper!
customer_reviews.author: eli day

customer_reviews.title: Solid, moveable.....but
customer_reviews.text: This works great, seats can be at different inclines, etc. It is, however, not tall enough for most SUVs, unless you have a massive center console.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic!
customer_reviews.text: This really is fantastic. I transport kids and dogs in my Honda CRV. The 15 year olds don't like dog hair on their clothes. So this keeps dogs in the back. It was incredibly easy to install--highly recommended!
customer_reviews.author: Duli

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Easy assembly and easy installation. I don’t think my dogs like it though.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Just what I needed
customer_reviews.text: Was quite happy with this barrier. I have large 120+ lbs dogs and had no problem. It even kepr my nervous big boy in the back of the SUV! He was able to sit close to me but not on top of my lol. Was easy to install. Even easy to uninstall and reinstall when needed. Would recommend.
customer_reviews.author: shopaddict

customer_reviews.title: easy to install and holds back our large as well ...
customer_reviews.text: Simple, easy to install and holds back our large as well as small dogs. Nobody has made it through to the front seat since we installed it! Love it! Solved a problem for us. Well worth it!
customer_reviews.author: M. Hirsch

customer_reviews.title: This is the one
customer_reviews.text: I now own two different options, the first one didn't work out. This one is easy to install, does so quickly and is not a sightline obstruction. Both dogs now safer behind it on the way to and from the park.
customer_reviews.author: JimD

customer_reviews.title: This item is a winner. Fits my Ford C-Max ...
customer_reviews.text: This item is a winner. Fits my Ford C-Max perfectly. The bars are widely placed so our dog still is engaged with us. A little hard to adjusts seats, but worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Ali H.

customer_reviews.title: Works Great
customer_reviews.text: Easily attaches to head rests with provided straps. Keeps my rambunctious 60# German Shorthaired Pointer puppy safely contained in the back seat. Now I only have to clean the back seat side windows instead of all of them. I highly recommend this. I would buy again.
customer_reviews.author: Mark Hillyer

customer_reviews.title: I do like that it is adjustable with the seats as well ...
customer_reviews.text: It keeps the dog out of the front seat. I do like that it is adjustable with the seats as well as adjustable with the width of the car. Easy to use.
customer_reviews.author: sewIbake

customer_reviews.title: Works, easy to install
customer_reviews.text: We have a 11 mos old 85 lb Doberman who liked to jump in the front seat. It works great. Keeps him in the back
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Okay but needs work
customer_reviews.text: It is well made, however it needs to bend in the middle because in both our cars the headrest extends straight up and the seat back then tilts forward at about 30 degrees leaving a gap at the bottom the dogs can get through. You have to jury rig a solution to make it work.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Scott

customer_reviews.title: Could be Great but not!
customer_reviews.text: Fits great in our 2016 Ford Explorer Sport behind 2nd row which has middle console gap. HOWEVER, the rattle when extendable bars are extended is unbearable, when pushed in no problem but then not wide enough to keep the dogs out of second row seats. can someone please tell me how to fix it 😩
customer_reviews.author: Dor

customer_reviews.title: Works Well and Easy to Setup/Remove
customer_reviews.text: We wanted a pet barrier that is easy to remove and this is perfect! Our dog doesn’t push much or anything like that, so it works well to keep her only in one area of the car. Easy to take down when not needed. It was exactly what we were looking for.
customer_reviews.author: Sami

product_meta.title: Zookeeper Pet Barrier – Adjustable and Universal for Cars, Trucks, SUVs – Moves with Your Vehicle Seats. Tilt. Slide. Recline. Easy Install Dog Car Gate - Strong Metal Tubing Gate Divider Barrier
feature_bullets: Seller ship will ship in 24-48 business hours from Kent, WA - if Prime shows bad ship times! BEST CAR, SUV PET BARRIER, DOG GATE, Driving with your dog should be hassle-free! ZooKeeper EZ Pet Barrier is a fully-adjustable dog gate designed to keep all safe and happy. This pet guard keeps your dog secure in the backseat: you and your pet enjoy more comfort and safety, with no distractions. Metal pet gate design allows for high visibility and clear lines of sight, for easier and safer driving.

SMART DESIGN FOR PERFECT FIT – This universal pet gate is 28.75” high and adjusts from 42” to 61” wide, a size that is versatile and portable. It's engineered to fit all types of vehicles, including 2-door and 4-door cars, SUVs, extended cab trucks, cabs, wagons and more. ZooKeeper Pet Barrier is the only pet barrier that tilts, slides, reclines and moves with your seats, for ultimate convenience. You'll love this versatile and simple dog barrier for cars.

SIMPLE TO INSTALL – No tools, no problem! ZooKeeper Pet Barrier is designed for easy installation and removal: no tools are required, no holes, nothing is permanent. Flexible cords wrap around your headrest posts, without affecting comfort or seat function. Move seats or adjust them without detaching this handy and effective pet guard. On the list of must-have dog accessories, this is near the top if you drive to the dog park or travel frequently with your pet.

BEST EZ PET BARRIER, GATE and GUARD SOLUTION – Use the right product for the job, for best safety and performance. This dog car barrier is superior to using a dog crate, dog carrier or pet carrier, cargo net or other device to secure your dog while driving. ZooKeeper Pet Barrier works great with small or large dog breeds. It offers better safety, comfort and protection for your pet and your vehicle than other products not designed specifically for frequent travel and commuting.

PURCHASE WITH CONFIDENCE – ZooKeeper Pet Barrier is engineered in the USA, we proudly offer 100% satisfaction and a no-hassle, money back guarantee. Adjustable design and secure fit protects your vehicle, virtually eliminates scratches and damage to interior surfaces. You and your dog will notice the difference in comfort and performance provided by this precision engineered dog car barrier. Thousands of happy customers already trust ZooKeeper car pet accessories! USA based company.
